content: “Incident after incident, the White House has failed to do or say much of anything, except to broadly condemn hate crimes.” And Trump only reluctantly “broadly condemns hate crimes” if enough pressure is put on him by the people. Then it’s short, perfunctory, and almost petulant — as if coming from a small child being forced to apologize to his sister. Of course, a sincere, believable condemnation might damage his white supremacist support. And his pathetic efforts to “broadly condemn hate crimes” are completely undone at the next opportunity he has for a rally where he can throw more gasoline on the fire of hatred.
